frame.name: Likelihood
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame is concerned with the likelihood of a <fen>Hypothetical_event</fen> occurring. The <fen>Hypothetical_event</fen> is its only core frame element.
<ex>It <m>is</m> <t>likely</t> <fex name="Hypothetical_event">that he'll arrive late</fex>.</ex>
Notice that in the case where a noun phrase is the subject of the Support Verb, that NP is also tagged as <fen>Hypothetical_event</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Hypothetical_event">He</fex> <m>is</m> <t>likely</t> <fex name="Hypothetical_event">to arrive late</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Hypothetical_event
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of affairs or occurrence whose likelihood is assessed. <ex><fex name="Evt">Rain</fex> is fairly <t>unlikely</t> today, I think.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE expresses a reason the speaker has for making judgment about the likelihood of an event.
<ex>There is a <fex name="Degree">high</fex> <t>chance</t> <fex name="Hypothetical_event">of rain</fex> <fex name="Explanation">because of the stormfront</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>Degree to which event occurs
<ex>There is a <fex name="Degree">high</fex> <t>probability</t> <fex name="Hypothetical_event">that it will rain today</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>Where the event takes place.
<ex>There is a <fex name="Degree">high</fex> <t>chance</t> <fex name="Hypothetical_event">of rain</fex> <fex name="Place">in Seattle</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>When the event occurs.
<ex>There is a <fex name="Degree">high</fex> <t>chance</t> <fex name="Hypothetical_event">of rain</fex> <fex name="Time">today</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> under which the <fen>Hypothetical_event</fen> is likely.
<ex>A positive placebo effect is more <t>likely</t> <fex name="cir">when both patient and physician believe that therapeutic benefit will result</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: certain.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: able to be firmly relied on to happen or be the case.

lexUnit.name: likely.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: such as well might happen or be true.

lexUnit.name: likelihood.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the state or fact of being likely.

lexUnit.name: certainty.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the quality of an event being inevitable

lexUnit.name: possible.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: capable of existing, happening, or being achieved

lexUnit.name: possibility.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the state or fact of being possible

lexUnit.name: chance.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a possibility of something happening

lexUnit.name: probable.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: likely to happen or be the case

lexUnit.name: unlikely.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not likely; improbable

lexUnit.name: impossible.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not able to occur, exist, or be done

lexUnit.name: improbability.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the extent to which something is improbable

lexUnit.name: prone.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: likely or liable to suffer from, do, or experience (something unfortunate)

lexUnit.name: sure.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: certain to receive, get, or do something

lexUnit.name: probability.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the extent to which something is probable

lexUnit.name: possibly.adv
lexUnit.definition: COD: (sentence adverb) perhaps

lexUnit.name: tend.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be likely NB: also has a use in the tendency frame. Clear examples of the likelihood-use of 'tend' are cases where the verb takes a passive verb phrase complement: "Men still tend to be taught to seek relationships with a larger number of people."

lexUnit.name: bound.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: destined or certain to be, do, or have something

lexUnit.name: may.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: expressing possibility

lexUnit.name: might.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: used to express possibility

lexUnit.name: probably.adv
lexUnit.definition: COD: almost certainly; as far as one knows or can tell.

lexUnit.name: likely.adv
lexUnit.definition: COD: probably

lexUnit.name: certainly.adv
lexUnit.definition: COD: definitely; undoubtedly.

lexUnit.name: guaranteed.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: certain to occur.

lexUnit.name: can.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: used to indicate that something is typically the case

lexUnit.name: long.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: (with respect to 'odds') greater than 10:1; (with respect to 'shot') unlikely

lexUnit.name: assured.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: protected against discontinuance or change

lexUnit.name: liable.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: [chielfly dialectal] likely.

lexUnit.name: surely.adv
lexUnit.definition: FN: certainly

lexUnit.name: undoubtedly.adv
lexUnit.definition: FN: without a feeling of uncertainty

lexUnit.name: must.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: indicates that the speaker has a high degree of confidence in inferring that the state of affairs described by the caluse is true

lexUnit.name: would.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: used to indicate a conditional state or action
